method: Take the chard leaves off the stalks and shred the leaves and stalks finely. Keep them separate. Heat the oil in a large frying pan or wok. Add the onions and the chard stalks and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until starting to soften. Add the garlic, chard leaves and orange zest and mix together. Season well and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until the leaves have wilted. Stir in the orange juice and serve at once.
ingredients: 1kg/2½lb chard, Swiss, ruby or rainbow are fine,  3 cloves garlic, peeled and crushed,  2 red onions, peeled and  finely chopped,  juice and zest 1 orange,  2 tbsp sunflower oil,  salt and pepper
